Description.val:
This line item funds modifications to the following cargo and transport aircraft:   C-9B, C-40A, C-20A, C-20D, C-20G, C-37A, C-37B, C-26D, EC-26D, RC-26D, UC-35C, UC-35D, UC-12B, UC-12F, UC-12M, UC-12W, RC-12F, RC-12M, and NC-12B.

The C-9B Skytrain II, C-40A Clipper, C-20A/D Gulfstream III, C-20G Gulfstream IV,  C-37A Gulfstream V, C-37 B Gulfstream 550,  UC-35C Cessna Ultra,  UC-35D Cessna Encore are commercial twin jet transport aircraft that provide time-critical medium lift logistic support for the fleet combatant commanders.  The C-9B is capable of carrying up to 32,000 pounds of cargo and personnel for over 1,739 nautical miles. The C-40A can accommodate 121 passengers, or 8 pallets of cargo, or a combination configuration of 3 pallets and 70 passengers with a range of 3,400 nautical miles.  The C-20G can accommodate 26 passengers or all pallets of cargo, or a combination of pallets and passengers with a range of 5,130 nautical miles.   The C-20A/D and C-37 provide worldwide executive transport to Secretary of the Navy, Chief of Naval Operations, Commandant of the Marine Corps, and Fleet Commanders.  The UC-35 provides transport for high priority passenger/cargo missions with time, place or mission sensitive requirements.  The UC-35 can accommodate 6 passengers or 1,200 pounds of cargo with a range of 1,300 nautical miles.  The C-12 King Air and C-26 Metro variants are commercial twin turbo-prop aircraft that provide shorter-range light lift passenger/cargo transport and range control missions.  The C-12 is capable of carrying 6 passengers or maximum cargo capacity of 2,850 pounds, with a range of 1,075 nautical miles. The C-26 is capable of carrying 19 passengers 1,300 nautical miles.

Block 1 aircraft modifications were procured between FY-04 and FY-11.  Some of the systems affected by Block 1 were Mode Select Elementary and Enhanced Surveillance, Enhanced Ground Proximity Warning System Runway Terrain Awareness and Warning System, Reduced Vertical Separation Minima, Honeywell Digital Cockpit Display System for Retrofit Aircraft or Rockwell Collins Pro-Line 21 modernization, 406MHz Emergency Locator Transmitter, Very High Frequency 8.33KHz spacing, Frequency Modulation Immunity, Cockpit voice recorder memory upgrades and incorporation of digital Flight management  and communication systems.  In FY12-FY14 Block 2 aircraft modifications will occur.  Some of the systems affected by Block 2 are Traffic Alert and Collision Avoidance System, Runway Awareness and Advisory System,  UniLink 800/801Aircraft Communications Addressing and Reporting System, Controller Pilot Data Link Communication and Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Contract datalink, Satellite Communications capability (Iridium or International Maritime Satellite) and services.  In FY15 - FY19 Block 3 aircraft modifications include Automatic Dependent Surveillance to DO260B standards, Data Link recording enhancements, Expansion of data link systems/services based on global operational data-link mandates, AN/APX-119 IFF, new control panel for Mode 5, Performance based navigation (RNAV/RNP), weather integration and L5 GLS capabilities.

Justification.val: Basis for FY2015 budget request: provides funding to procure aircraft modifications for Cargo Transport Aircraft.

ModificationTitle.val: FEDERAL AVIATION ADMINISTRATION (FAA) CONFIGURATION UPDATES RESERVE FORCES(OSIP 071-86)

Title.val: FEDERAL AVIATION ADMINISTRATION (FAA) CONFIGURATION UPDATES RESERVE FORCES(OSIP 071-86)

Description.val:
Federal Aviation Regulations require manufacturers of commercial aircraft and associated systems/subsystems to investigate discrepant conditions, failures, and potential safety problems reported by all operators.  The results of these investigations with recommended corrective action are reviewed/authorized by Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) designated representatives and provided to all operators as service bulletins.  Each service bulletin is a complete technical directive that provides corrective change information or detailed modification instructions.  To ensure safe, reliable, FAA/Navy certified aircraft and to provide a program that will assure continued life extension at minimum cost, the Navy must maintain configuration and integrity compatible with FAA certified commercial models by incorporation of applicable service bulletins.  The incorporation of certain service bulletins also serves to preclude extensive repairs/repetitive inspections.  Crew equipment requirements in accordance with FAA directives and/or Navy requirements will be incorporated to ensure maximum safety in case of emergency.  Specific examples of systems that will require modification to conform to FAA Service Bulletins and Directives include Brakes, Landing Gear Systems, Flight Controls, Engine Modifications, Propeller Modifications, Airframe Modifications, Hydraulics, Electrical/Mechanical Systems & Components, Fuel Systems, Software Modifications/Upgrades, Fire Detection Systems, Interior Environmental Systems, Pressurization Systems, Oxygen Systems, Pilot-Static Systems and Smoke/Fire Detection Systems.  Modifications budgeted in this Operational Safety and Improvement Program include the incorporation of Service Bulletins/Directives requirements into the C-9B, C-40A, C-20A, C-20D, C-20G, C-37A, C-37B, C-26D, EC-26D, RC-26D, UC-35C, UC-35D, UC-12B, UC-12F, UC-12M, UC-12W, RC-12F, RC-12M, and NC-12B aircraft.

Development Status/Major Development Milestones: Service Bulletins are reviewed for possible incorporation on an as required basis.  Prototype verification has been previously accomplished and approved by the FAA.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Depot Contractor : Installation Name: CNS/ATM C-40A/C-9
Depot Contractor : Installation Name: CNS/ATM C-37
Depot Contractor : Installation Name: CNS/ATM UC-35
Depot Contractor : Installation Name: CNS/ATM C-26
Depot Contractor : Installation Name: CNS/ATM C-20
Depot Contractor : Installation Name: CNS/ATM C-12
Not Installed - HF Radio Upgrade C-20A

Description.val:
World-wide airspace congestion and communication bandwidth saturation has led the International Civil Aviation Organization to restructure the world-wide airspace structure to improve safety through a series of equipment and performance mandates implemented by regional authorities. The Type/Models/Series cited below will be required to comply with Communication, Navigation and Surveillance - Air Traffic Management (CNS-ATM) mandates to retain the Navy's capability to operate these aircraft worldwide. Failure to comply with these time-phased mandates will result in being denied access to high-volume airspace (routing and altitudes) and airfields, and result in circuitous routing and sub optimal altitudes. Required modifications to meet these CNS-ATM mandates are being implemented on post production aircraft as capabilities listed in the third paragraph.

To minimize the impact of successive modifications and maximize aircraft availability, a block upgrade approach has been taken during this budget submit. C-20D, C-12 and C-26 expenditures in FY09 and prior years comprise part of Block 1. Block upgrades have been prioritized and phased to meet regional mandates' just in time to ensure that commercial CNS-ATM solutions are available off the shelf to minimize non-reoccurring engineering associated with Federal Aviation Administration supplemental type certification. In order to incorporate CNS-ATM mandates several older aircraft (C-20D, C-35C, all C-26 and C-12) required the installation of a digital flight management and communication system.

Archived Mods:  All Block 1 modification upgrades have been completed for the following aircraft: C-9B, C-40A, C-20A, C-20D, C-20G, C-37A, C-37B, C-26D, EC-26D, RC-26D, UC-26D, UC-35C, UC-35D, UC-12B, UC-12F, UC-12M.

CNS-ATM capabilities associated with each Block Upgrade are listed below:
C-9B: Block 2 - Upgrade Flight Management Software to 1000.6 and incorporate new solid state dataloader, Traffic Alert and Collision Avoidance System (TCAS 7.1), EGPWS  altitude callouts and Runway Awareness and Advisory System;  incorporate UniLink 800/801Aircraft Communications Addressing and Reporting System (ACARS), Air Traffic Service (ATS) Facilities Notification (AFN), Controller Pilot Data Link Communication (CPDLC) and Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Contract (ADS-C) datalink, activate Very High Frequency Data Link (VDL)-2 and add Satellite Communication (SATCOM) capability [Iridium or International Maritime Satellite (INMARSAT)] and services; New Multifunction display and Ground Based Augmentation Landing System (GLS). No Block 3. 
C-40A: Block 2 - TCAS 7.1, Activate VDL-2 and add SATCOM capability (Iridium or INMARSAT) and services; Upgrade Flight Management Software with U10.8A Operational Flight Program and incorporate new solid state dataloader.  Block 3 - Automatic Dependent Surveillance to DO260B standards, Data Link recording enhancements, Expansion of data link systems/services based on global operational data-link mandates, AN/APX-119 IFF, new control panel for Mode 5, Performance based navigation (RNAV/RNP), weather integration and L5 GLS Installs.
C-37A/B: Block 2: TCAS 7.1, incorporate Airframe Service Change (ASC) 183, 186, 187, 188; add  provisions for ACARS, ATS Facilities Notification, CPDLC and ADS-C datalink, Communication Management Unit (CMU), add VDL-2 and SATCOM capability (Iridium or INMARSAT) and services. Block 3 - Automatic Dependent Surveillance to DO260B standards, Data Link recording enhancements, Expansion of data link systems/services based on global operational data-link mandates, AN/APX-119 IFF, new control panel for Mode 5, Performance based navigation (RNAV/RNP), weather integration and L5 GLS Installs. 
C-35C: Block 2 - Install Electronic Standby Instrument System ESIS + new instrument panels+ install Universal Navigation System (UNS)-1Espw with Wide Area Augmentation System (WAAS) + Localizer Performance with Vertical Guidance (LPV); TCAS 7.1 and new display to replace obsolete MST-67/Multi Function Display (MFD); incorporate UniLink 800/801Aircraft Communications Addressing and Reporting System (ACARS), Air Traffic Service (ATS) Facilities Notification (AFN), Controller Pilot Data Link Communication (CPDLC) and Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Contract (ADS-C) datalink CMU, add VDL-2 and SATCOM capability (Iridium or INMARSAT) and services.  Block 3-Automatic Dependent Surveillance to DO260B standards, Data Link recording enhancements, Expansion of data link systems/services based on global operational data-link mandates, AN/APX-119 IFF, new control panel for Mode 5, Performance based navigation (RNAV/RNP), weather integration and L5 GLS Installs.
C-35D: Block 2 - Install UNS-1Espw with WAAS/Satellite Based Augmentation System/LPV; TCAS 7.1 and new display to replace obsolete MST-67/MFD; incorporate UniLink 800/801Aircraft Communications Addressing and Reporting System (ACARS), Air Traffic Service (ATS) Facilities Notification (AFN), Controller Pilot Data Link Communication (CPDLC) and Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Contract (ADS-C) datalink, add VDL-2 and SATCOM capability (Iridium or INMARSAT) and services. Block 3 - Automatic Dependent Surveillance to DO260B standards, Data Link recording enhancements, Expansion of data link systems/services based on global operational data-link mandates, AN/APX-119 IFF, new control panel for Mode 5, Performance based navigation (RNAV/RNP), weather integration and L5 GLS Installs. 
C-26 EC/RC/UC-26D: Block 2 - Install Flight Management System upgrade, Proline 21, WAAS & RNP, TCAS 7.1, add provisions for ACARS, ATS Facilities Notification, CPDLC and ADS-C datalink, CMU, add VDL-2 and SATCOM capability (Iridium or INMARSAT) and services. Block 3 - Automatic Dependent Surveillance to DO260B standards, Data Link recording enhancements, Expansion of data link systems/services based on global operational data-link mandates, AN/APX-119 IFF, new control panel for Mode 5, Performance based navigation (RNAV/RNP), weather integration and L5 GLS Installs.
C-20A: Block 2 - TCAS 7.1, CPDLC, Data Loader Upgrade; No Block 3.  
C-20D: Block 2 - TCAS 7.1, install APX119 Transponder, FMS 6.1 upgrade, WAAS & RNP, add provisions for ACARS, ATS Facilities Notification, CPDLC and ADS-C datalink, VDL-2 and SATCOM capability (Iridium or INMARSAT) and services.  No Block 3.  
C-20G: Block 2 - TCAS 7.1, install APX119 Transponder, incorporate ASC 476, 477, 478 & 479; WAAS & RNP Upgrade, add provisions for ACARS, ATS Facilities Notification, CPDLC and ADS-C datalink, VDL-2 and SATCOM capability (Iridium or INMARSAT) and services.  Block 3 - Automatic Dependent Surveillance to DO260B standards, Data Link recording enhancements, Expansion of data link systems/services based on global operational data-link mandates, AN/APX-119 IFF, new control panel for Mode 5, Performance based navigation (RNAV/RNP), weather integration and L5 GLS Installs.
C-12B: Block 2 - TCAS 7.1 + New Flight management system.  No Block 3.  
C-12F: Block 2 - TCAS 7.1, Install FMS upgrade and new solid state dataloader DBU-5010, WAAS & RNP, add provisions for ACARS, ATS Facilities Notification, CPDLC and ADS-C datalink, CMU, add VDL-2 and SATCOM capability (Iridium or INMARSAT) and services, Implement Mode 5 upgrade.  Block 3 Automatic Dependent Surveillance to DO260B standards, Data Link recording enhancements, Expansion of data link systems/services based on global operational data-link mandates, AN/APX-119 IFF, new control panel for Mode 5, Performance based navigation (RNAV/RNP), weather integration and L5 GLS Installs.
C-12M: Block 2 - TCAS 7.1, Install FMS upgrade and new solid state dataloader DBU-5010, WAAS & RNP, add provisions for ACARS, ATS Facilities Notification, CPDLC and ADS-C datalink, CMU, add VDL-2 and SATCOM capability (Iridium or INMARSAT) and services, Implement Mode 5 upgrade; Block 3 - Automatic Dependent Surveillance to DO260B standards, Data Link recording enhancements, Expansion of data link systems/services based on global operational data-link mandates, AN/APX-119 IFF, new control panel for Mode 5, Performance based navigation (RNAV/RNP), weather integration and L5 GLS Installs.
UC-12W: Block 2 - TCAS 7.1; Aural Tone Warning, Install FMS upgrade, WAAS & RNP; add provisions for ACARS, ATS Facilities Notification, CPDLC and ADS-C datalink; CMU, add VDL-2 and SATCOM capability (Iridium or INMARSAT) and services.  Block 3 -  Automatic Dependent Surveillance to DO260B standards, Data Link recording enhancements, Expansion of data link systems/services based on global operational data-link mandates, AN/APX-119 IFF, new control panel for Mode 5, Performance based navigation (RNAV/RNP), weather integration and L5 GLS Installs.

Name.@footnote: Installs in FY14 are funded with FY12 OCO per OCO funding guidance to request funds for the entire effort.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Contractor Depot : Installation Name: Extended Range Tanks (OCO)

Description.val: Southwest Asia Marine Expeditionary Force (MEF) Commanders lack light Operational Support Aircraft (OSA) lift assets capable of operating in threat Surface To Air Missile (SAM) environments of Southwest Asia (i.e. Iraq, Afghanistan).  As a consequence, limited high value medium lift logistic assets (KC-130s) capable of operating in threat SAM environments, are being tasked to perform light OSA personnel and material movement requirements.  To fill this OSA requirement, the UC-12W is being modified in order to provide relief to tactical assets that are better utilized in direct support to the warfighter.  A Naval Air Systems Command Program Management Aviation Office 272 study determined the current Aircraft Survivability Equipment (ASE) system on the UC-12W is less effective against the advance Infrared  missile threats now being deployed.  Additionally, the limited range of the UC-12W limits the ability of the aircraft to fully support mission requirements of the MEF commander.  This Operational, Safety and Improvement Program upgrades UC-12W aircraft with an additional ALE-47 Forward Firing Dispenser and Extended Range (ER) Tanks.  The additional ALE-47 dispenser will increase the effectiveness of the ASE system against the advanced threats being deployed, allowing the UC-12W to safely support Operation Iraqi Freedom operations in more areas currently requiring the use of high value tactical assets.  The addition of the ER Tanks increases the effective range of the UC-12W by 33% to 2,300 nm greatly increasing its ability to support OSA missions over a larger area than currently planned.
